Desc.entry: A group run by Chilypep (see separate entry) for black and minority ethnic (BME) young women aged 14-21 years which aims to bring young people together and discuss issues affecting young women from BME communities. The Forum works to challenge views about BME women, as well as train young people to do peer research and offer trainer workshops to community groups, the police etc to help then gain a better understanding of working with young women from BME communities. The forum gives young women the opportunity to learn new skills, chair meetings, gain accreditations, have their say and influence policy making, take part in residentials and day trips, make new friends and have fun. Chilypep is a registered charity.
